results.title: Le Francais par le film. No. 05
results.brief_description: Comprises twelve graduated lessons, each of which introduces a typical scene of French life and customs and stresses some part of French grammar. This episode centres around receiving visitors at home and the time, the calendar and seasons of the year. Demonstrative pronouns and adjectives are dealt with in this lesson.

results.title: Le Francais par le film. No. 04
results.brief_description: Comprises twelve graduated lessons, each of which introduces a typical scene of French life and customs and stresses some part of French grammar. This episode centres around a tour of Paris and stresses pronominal adverbs, comparative and superlative adjectives and irregular comparisons.

results.title: Le Francais par le film. No. 03
results.brief_description: Comprises twelve graduated lessons, each of which introduces a typical scene of French life and customs and stresses some part of French grammar. This episode centres around the home and the limbs and parts of the body. Grammar refers to negatives, and personal and possessive pronouns.

results.title: Le Francais par le film. No. 02
results.brief_description: Comprises twelve graduated lessons, each of which introduces a typical scene of French life and customs and stresses some part of French grammar. This episode centres around the tea table and a railway station with emphasis on inflection in connected speech, and the partitive article.

results.title: Le Francais par le film. No. 01
results.brief_description: Comprises twelve graduated lessons, each of which introduces a typical scene of french life and customs and stresses some part of French grammar. This first episode is an introduction to the characters - a French family. Stresses pronunciation of certain French vowels and consonants.

results.title: Le Feu = the Fire
results.brief_description:
Paul, a childhood friend of Judge Elizabeth Massot is dreaming of transforming his country estate into a bird reserve. Unfortunately, his brother, who co-owns the property, has promised it to a land developper. During a bush fire, Paul’s property is devastated by the flames; the following day, the bulldozers arrive to start work on Paul’s land. Judge Massot who is in charge of establishing the criminal origin of the fires cannot fathom why Paul is refusing to file charges against the fire-bugs.

Credits: Producer, Jean Gauthier ; director, Philippe Condroyer ; writers, Mariette Condroyer, Roger Grenier ; photography, Jean-Jacques Rochut ; music, Antoine Duhamel.
Cast: Simone Signoret, Didier Haudepin, Jean-Calude Dauphin, Maurice Garrel, Francois Perrot, Michel Vitold, Michel Blanc.

results.title: Le Farceur = the Joker
results.creator_credit: Roland Nonin and Philippe De Broca
results.brief_description:
Edouard Berlon is a happy go lucky character who falls in love with the beautiful wife of a rich industrialist. Unfortunately she does not return his affections. The devastated Edouard reacts by playing sad songs on his bassoon while he waits for death. This eccentric behavior charms the woman into changing her mind and running off with him. His restored exuberance is again dampened when he discovers this beautiful woman is stone cold in bed.

Credits: Producer, Roland Nonin ; director, Philippe de Broca ; writers, Daniel Boulanger, Philippe de Broca ; photography, Jean Penzer ; music, Georges Delerue.
Cast: Jean-Pierre Cassel, Anouk Aimee, Pierre Palau, Georges Wilson, Genevieve Cluny.

results.title: Le Fantome de la Liberte = The Phantom of Liberty
results.brief_description:
A series of casually linked episodes moving from Toledo in 1808 and Goya’s painting of ‘The executions of 3 May’ to contemporary Paris where various people try to grasp or shun, in Karl Marx’s phrase, ‘the phantom of liberty’. This is Bunuel’s very personal version of ‘La Ronde’. In eight sketches - each representing a different aspect of hypocrisy - he creates a succession of dazzling moments. The sketches use every type of comedy: there is an interval of French farce with slamming bedroom doors, two black jokes about cancer and mass murder and a piece of pure Ionesco. Each sketch has its point to make and its own authority figures to be lampooned. This is a delightful and hilarious Bunuelian masterpiece.

Credits: Producer: Serge Silberman ; director, Luis Bunuel ; writers, Luis Bunuel, Jean-Claude Carriere ; photography, Edmond Richard.
Cast: Adriana Asti, Julien Bertheau, Michel Piccoli, Adolfo Celi, Milena Vukotic, Jean-Claude Brialy, Monica Vitti, Muni, Paul Frankeur, Michel Lonsdale, Pierre Maguelon, Framcois Maistre, Helene Perdriere, Claude Pieplu, Jean Rochefort, Bernard Verle

results.title: Le Doulos = the Finger Man
results.creator_credit: Georges de Beauregard and Jean-Pierre Melville
results.brief_description:
Maurice, just out of jail, seeks out revenge from a fence who had his wife killed. Maurice kills the fence and steels some jewellery which he hides. But the murder is not enough. Maurice prepares an other heist with Silien, whom the ‘milieu’ (the underworld) suspects to be a ‘doulos’ (an informer). ‘Le Doulos’ is one of Melville’s many homages to American Cinema. The sets for the offices of Commissaire Clain were modelled on those used by Ruben Mamoulian in ‘City Streets’. For the confrontation scene between Silien and Clain, Melville directed a 9 min. 39 sec. shot with a 360 degree pan.

Credits: Producer, Georges de Beauregard ; director, Jean-Pierre Melville ; writers, Jean-Pierre Melville, Elisabeth Rappeneau ; photography, Nicolas Hayer ; music, Paul Misraki ; art direction, Daniel Gueret, Pierre Charron ; assistant directior, Vol
Cast: Jean-Paul Belmondo, Serge Reggiani, Jean Desailly, Fabienne Dali, Michel Piccoli, Marcel Cuvelier, Jack Leonard, Aime de March, Monique Hennessy.

results.title: Le Dossier Francoise Muller = the Francoise Muller Case
results.brief_description:
Following an apparence on a TV show, economist Gerard Plantier is murdered in the underground garage of his appartment building. The only witnesses are his girlfriend, Francoise, and the night watchman. As the investigation progresses, it is revealed that Francoise had a rather shady past and that some of her former acquaintances may have something to do with Gerard’s death. To Judge Massot’s surprise, Francoise is doing her best to attract all the blame for the murder to herself.

Credits: Producer, Jean Gauthier ; director, Edouard Molinaro ; writer, Alphonse Boudard ; photography, Alain Levent ; music, Vladimir Cosma.
Cast: Simone Signoret, Michel Vitold, Jean-Claude Dauphin, Didier Haudepin, Bernard Pivot, Albert Simonin, Nathalie Delon, Jean-Pierre Darras, Andre Pousse, Saddy Rebbot, Katy Amaizo, Germaine Delbat, Andre Lacombe, Henry Rellys.
